instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.820-3462: What is 820-3462? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> battery keeps killing <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>
threads.message:
macbook came in dead, after checking <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> was only 1.5V. Replaced ISL chip and laptop successfully boot up(without battery)
so installed into chassis screwed in the battery and tested boot up fine with charging cable. 2nd restart macbook does not boot up anymore, measured <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> back to 1.5v, ISL dead again, so i was thinking maybe bad ISL and replaced again but same shit happens. Conclusion is ISL gets killed with battery is plugged in.

I measure all current sensing resisters and all was fine. tried replacing the battery(tried different vendors) also same. gone through about 6 isl chips now and still no idea why this is happening.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> battery keeps killing <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>
threads.message:
SMC is much more sensitive and should crash first; in case of overvoltage through I2C battery bus.
So there must be other reason.

Check all resistors in <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> area.
Be sure <RESISTOR>R7090</RESISTOR> is NOT soldered.
Just in case, replace <CAPACITOR>C7025</CAPACITOR>.
What is the exact <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> voltage without battery?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> battery keeps killing <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>
threads.message: Got this fixed, issue was with inrush limited mosfet <TRANSISTOR>Q7080</TRANSISTOR>. not sure how but replaced this and everything is fine now
